Methods

(static) parse(tagValue, canHaveName, canHaveType) → {module:jsdoc/tag/type.TagInfo}

Parse the value of a JSDoc tag.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
tagValue string The value of the tag. For example, the tag `@param {string} name` has a value of `{string} name`.
canHaveName boolean Indicates whether the value can include a symbol name.
canHaveType boolean Indicates whether the value can include a type expression that describes the symbol.
Source:
  • tag/type.js, line 288
Throws:
Thrown if a type expression cannot be parsed.
Type
Error
Returns:
Information obtained from the tag.
Type
module:jsdoc/tag/type.TagInfo

Type Definitions

TagInfo

Information provided in a JSDoc tag.
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
TagInfo.defaultvalue string The default value of the member.
TagInfo.name string The name of the member (for example, `myParamName`).
TagInfo.nullable boolean Indicates whether the member can be set to `null` or `undefined`.
TagInfo.optional boolean Indicates whether the member is optional.
TagInfo.text string Descriptive text for the member (for example, `The user's email address.`).
TagInfo.type Array.<string> The type or types that the member can contain (for example, `string` or `MyNamespace.MyClass`).
TagInfo.typeExpression string The type expression that was parsed to identify the types.
TagInfo.variable boolean Indicates whether the number of members that are provided can vary (for example, in a function that accepts any number of parameters).
Source:
  • tag/type.js, line 125

TypeExpressionInfo

Information about a type expression extracted from tag text.
Properties:
Name Type Description
expression string The type expression.
text string The updated tag text.
Source:
  • tag/type.js, line 19
